info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 3:01PM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Snow with additional accumulations 1 to 4 inches. Northwest winds gusting up to 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central Illinois. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until noon CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Saturday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult at times due to slick and snow covered roads. Blowing and drifting snow tonight and Saturday morning will likely result in near blizzard conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, which could lead to isolated power outages. For later this weekend into early next week, dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as ten minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain and possibly brief freezing rain will mix with snow at times today, and may even become all rain for a period before cold air and strong winds move in changing the precipitation back to all snow. Tonight, much colder air moves in which could result in a flash freeze on roadways.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
